intro: Yoania aberrans, commonly known as the rare leafy liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Peltasporaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, thalloid structure composed of a flat, leaf-like body that is often covered in small, leaf-like appendages called phyllidia. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are clustered in cup-like formations called soruses. Yoania aberrans plays a vital role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
